## Overview

The Global Antimicrobial Resistance and Use Surveillance System (GLASS) is WHO's flagship initiative supporting global surveillance of antimicrobial resistance (AMR) and antimicrobial use (AMU). GLASS provides standardized, validated data to inform decision-making and drive local, national, and regional action.

## Key Features

- **Global Coverage**: Data from over 100 countries worldwide
- **Standardized Methods**: Harmonized surveillance protocols and data collection
- **AMR and AMU Data**: Resistance patterns and antimicrobial consumption data
- **Priority Pathogens**: Focus on WHO priority pathogens list
- **Public Reports**: Annual reports and data visualizations
- **Early Warning System**: Detection of emerging resistance patterns

## Use Cases in Research

- Global antimicrobial resistance trends
- Comparative international AMR epidemiology
- Impact of antimicrobial stewardship interventions
- Resistance pattern modeling and prediction
- Policy evaluation for AMR control
- One Health approaches to AMR surveillance

## Getting Started

Visit the [WHO GLASS website](https://www.who.int/initiatives/glass) to access reports and learn about data access procedures.
